meanings.definition: Impose or collect (a tax, fee, or fine)
meanings.sent1: The government can levy taxes to pay for public services.
meanings.sent2: The city council decided to levy a small fee for parking in the downtown area.
meanings.sent3: When the mischievous leprechaun tried to levy a candy tax on the children, they all laughed.
meanings.sent4: The teacher levied a heavy workload on the students before the exam, causing stress.
meanings.sent5: The landlord can levy a penalty for late rent payments to ensure tenants pay on time.

meanings.definition: A tax or fee imposed by authority
meanings.sent1: The levy on imported goods helped protect local businesses.
meanings.sent2: The property owners were unhappy with the new levy imposed by the city.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected levy on ice cream sales left the shop owner feeling frozen in shock.
meanings.sent4: The levy on sugary drinks was seen as a way to promote healthier choices.
meanings.sent5: The council announced a new levy on dog owners to fund a local animal shelter.
